titleStmt.title: Lycurgus Kingcade et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5503

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Exolency Thomas E Bramlette
Govner of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

We your Petitionists would represent your Exollency that at the May term (1864) of the Owsley Circuit Court E G Creech was fined $60.00) for tipling three offenses was charges to have Bin committed some five years since we would further represent that Mr Creech is a poor man and a law abiding citizen and it would greatly distress him and his family to have the fine to pay we would theire fore humbbly aks you to extend your Executive clemency and remit so much of the fine as is Due the Commonwealth of Kentucky and in duty Bound will every pray

Lycurgus Kingcade
Charles Lutes
Abraham Gunn
John..G. Spencer
Elisha Shoemaker
David Marshal
Henry Marshal
F. M. Snowden
Squire Adams
W H Reed
Dr C J Blount
William Tencher Sr
G B Snowden
Larcin Stamper
Leander Critzer

strong spenser

Owsley Cir Ct
vs
